abstract: The Internet giant is looking to buy Alibaba.com, its only publicly traded unit, at close to 13.50 Hong Kong dollars per share, roughly in line with its I.P.O. price.
snippet: The Internet giant is looking to buy Alibaba.com, its only publicly traded unit, at close to 13.50 Hong Kong dollars per share, roughly in line with its I.P.O. price.
lead_paragraph: The Alibaba Group, the Chinese Internet giant, is preparing to take private its only publicly traded unit, whose shares have sank over the past year following a corporate scandal.

headline.main: Alibaba Poised to Take Subsidiary Private
